page.title: 14TANSOR
page.content: Tansor is a small linear settlement two miles north-east of{Oundle} surrounded by arable farm-land with grass and wheat most prominent in July 1985. The village has a population of 151 according to the East Northamptonshire District Council handbook produced in 1983. There are virtually no amenities in the village with no pub, post-office or shop. One bus each way each day <no.323> joins Tansor, Oundle and Peterborough. The main features of the village include the church of St.Mary which is thought to date from the eleventh century, although parts of the east aisle date from as late as the fourteenth century. The magnificent building of Tansor Court dominates the northern edge from where the neighbouring village of Cotterstock can be seen.
